main event: Two naval aviators reported sighting a heart-shaped, white-buff object at high altitude on 27 February 1959.
interesting points: The object was first detected on radar before being visually confirmed.,Both pilots reported the object as stationary at high altitude and resembling a dime in size.,The object reached altitudes estimated to be over 75,000 feet.,It left no visible trail or exhaust features during the observation.,The total observation time was approximately ten minutes.
location: 29 MI W of Oceanside, California, USA
witness description: two naval aviators from VMF(AW) 513, MAG-15 flying F4D aircraft
